about_the_game:
Endless RPG is a random map and adventure generator for Dungeons and Dragons 5e and Pathfinder 1e roleplaying games.

This random map generator is not a game. It is a tool for playing tabletop pen-and-paper role-playing games (TTRPG). Endless RPG allows you to play D&D solo or in a group without a dedicated dungeon master. It can also be used as a DM tool for quickly building maps already populated with encounters, traps and treasures. 

  • Create random dungeons, caves, ruins, crypts, tombs, strongholds, keeps

  • Map themes help define the type of map with 40 unique combinations allowing you to create a webbed cave, unholy stronghold, mystic tower, military keep, dungeon jail, etc.

  • Quick missions will roll up a map with a random enemy and in a random location

  • Custom maps allow you to specify a primary and a secondary enemy as well as choose a map type and theme

  • Create parties of up to 8 characters

  • A Quick Battle mode for keeping up with the current HP and initiative of all combatants

  • A Battle Map mode to help with tactical combat.

  • Tracks all treasure looted and monsters defeated to make end-of-session wrap-up easier to handle.

  • Supports D&D 5e and Pathfinder 1e

*** PLAY D&D SOLO OR IN A GROUP WITHOUT A DM ***

The primary focus of Endless RPG is solo players looking for a tool that will help them play D&D or Pathfinder alone.  It is also designed for small groups that do not have a dedicated Dungeon Master but still want to go on fun adventures. 

Maps are explored through a fog-of-war discovery system with encounters, traps, tricks, and treasures displayed as you encounter them. This is perfect for solo play or groups without a DM as you will get no hints of what is behind the next door. (Unless you cast Clairvoyance!)

Custom Dungeons allow you to pick the CR level, environment (dungeon, cave, etc.), primary and secondary enemies (orcs, undead, demons, etc.), and an overall difficulty level.  Map types can also have themes such as mystic, unholy, military, etc.  These themes can even affect the types of creatures found within: a mystic tower with mercenaries may hold some conjurers summoning demons while a military tower might be lighter on the use of magic.

You can also choose Quick Mission for a random location and enemy groups.

*** QUICK BATTLE AND BATTLE MAPS FOR COMBAT MANAGEMENT***

While Endless RPG is not intended to replace your favorite combat management app, it does have a few management tools in place to use as aids. The app will help keep track of hit points at all times while you are adventuring. When dealing with encounters, you can also choose to use a Quick Combat screen, which tracks initiative and hit points or all combatants, or a Battle Map, which also tracks where combatants are in relation to each other.

*** D&D 5TH EDITION OR PATHFINDER 1E ***

The two most popular tabletop roleplaying systems are supported including the most popular monsters, enemies and beasts. Endless RPG uses its own approach to overcoming obstacles such as locked or blocked doors, sealed chests or dangerous traps. These mechanics make use of various character skills and scale for both systems, so traps in D&D 5e will have discipline checks appropriate for that system while Pathfinder 1e traps are tuned for Pathfinder.

*** SUPPORTS UP TO 8 CHARACTERS ***

Players can run through the dungeon as a single character or a party of up to eight characters. A "character" can also include guard dogs, guard bears, druid companions or other non-standard creatures.
